content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Create an array to store the extracted code blocks
    code_blocks = Vector{String}()

    # Regular expression for matching Julia code blocks
    re_code_block = r"^```julia\n([\s\S]*?)^```\n"m

    # Find all occurrences of Julia code blocks in the markdown document
    for match in eachmatch(re_code_block, md)
        # Extract the content of the code block and add it to the array
        content = strip(String(match.captures[1]))
        push!(code_blocks, content)
    end

    # Join all the code blocks together with a newline if there are multiple
    if length(code_blocks) > 1
        joined_code = join(code_blocks, "\n")
    else
        # If there is only one code block, return it directly
        joined_code = code_blocks[1]
    end

    # Remove the leading and trailing newlines from the joined code
    return strip(joined_code)
end
```

This function `extract_julia_code` takes a string `md` containing markdown content with Julia code blocks and returns a string with all the extracted code blocks concatenated together.
